news_header: Lord Alan Sugar advocates for apprentices and workers to return to the office, criticizing remote work culture.
news_text: Lord Alan Sugar, known for his role on BBC's The Apprentice, believes that apprentices and workers should return to the office, emphasizing the importance of in-person interaction for learning. He criticizes the trend of remote work, stating that many young people prefer to stay at home. Sugar acknowledges exceptions for certain professions but insists that being present in the workplace is crucial for newcomers. He also expresses his disapproval of using AI for job applications and reflects on the negative impacts of Brexit. Despite his strong opinions, he has no political ambitions.
